definitions.definition: not large, strong or important enough for a particular purpose
definitions.sensetop: insufficient to do somethinginsufficient for something

examples.text: The management paid insufficient attention to working conditions.
There are fears that the existing flood barrier may prove insufficient.
I’m afraid we have insufficient evidence.
His salary is insufficient to meet his needs.
The plan was to refurbish the whole building but the funds raised were insufficient for the purpose.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘incapable, incompetent’): via Old French from late Latin insufficient- ‘not sufficing’, from in- ‘not’ + Latin sufficere ‘put under, meet the need of’ (from sub- ‘under’ + facere ‘make’).
